contentrichtext.text: [[Image:Landsat GlacierBay 01aug99.jpg|thumb|right|Silted [[meltwater]] from the [[Brady Glacier]] discolours the shallow waters of Icy Strait]] The '''Icy Strait''' is a [[strait]] in the [[Alexander Archipelago]] in southeastern [[Alaska]], at about {{coord|58|16|41|N|135|38|48|W|scale:1000000|display=inline,title}}. The strait separates [[Chichagof Island]] to the south and the Alaska mainland to the north. The strait is {{convert|64|km|mi|abbr=on}} from its west side at the intersection of the [[Cross Sound]] and [[Glacier Bay]] to its east side at [[Chatham Strait]] and the [[Lynn Canal]]. The two largest islands in the strait are [[Pleasant Island (Alaska)|Pleasant Island]] and [[Lemesurier Island]]. The [[Cape Spencer Light (Alaska)|Cape Spencer Light]] is an important former lighthouse and currently active aid-to-navigation. The [[cruise ship]] [[Empress of the North]] ran aground near Rocky Island <ref>http://en.wikinews.org/wiki/Alaskan_cruise_ship_evacuated</ref> and took on some water here on May 14, 2007, causing the evacuation of its passengers. None were injured. ==References== {{Reflist}} [[Category:Straits of Alaska]] [[Category:Landforms of Haines Borough, Alaska]] [[Category:Landforms of Hoonahâ€“Angoon Census Area, Alaska]]
